item.title: Stalker 2: How To Unlock Agricultural Workshop (PSZ-9D Duty Armor)
item.description:
Stalker 2: Heart of Chornobyl has a huge map with several locations that are locked off, requiring players to either find a code or a key to access them. As these inaccessible locations usually have some great loot locked behind them, it's worth checking them out. One of these locations is called the Agricultural Workshop in the Yantar region, with a locked stairwell that leads to some valuable loot. Here's how players can unlock access to upper floors and secure the loot.

How to Unlock the Yantar Agricultural Workshop & Get PSZ-9D Duty Armor in Stalker 2

Players can find the Agricultural Workshop in the Yantar region southwest of the Rostok Base in Stalker 2 . After entering the POI, you'll notice that one of the stairwells in the building is locked. You'll be able to find the key inside the compound, but it'll take a bit of exploration. However, it's worth reaching the top of this building as you'll be getting a powerful armor piece to equip and lots of valuable loot.

There are two entries to the compound, and it's recommended that you enter through the entrance to the west to follow this guide easily.

Unlocking the Stairwell in the Agricultural Workshop Building

The first thing you'll need to do is open the stairwell in the building to the right. To do that, you'll need to find the first key. Here's how you can do that.

  1. Enter the Agricultural Workshop POI, take an immediate left, and enter the building.
  2. Keep heading further into the building until you come across an open stairwell. Reach the top and go through the room until you arrive at the catwalk with Electro anomaly.
  3. Carefully follow along the catwalk and make sure to pick up some loot along the way. Once you reach the end, you can pick up the first key beside a body.
  4. Take the key, enter the second building to the right, and use it to unlock the stairwell.

Getting the Second Key to the Skybridge

Now, you'll need another key to make your way over to the other part of the building by unlocking the skybridge .

  1. Head up the stairwell, and you'll notice that the entrance to the first floor is locked off. So, head over to the second floor instead.
  2. After arriving at the second floor, go through the corridor ahead and take a right. Keep moving forward until you come out of the building and onto a broken emergency staircase.
  3. Look to the right, and you'll see a makeshift platform that's right beside an open window. Vault over the railing of the staircase and onto the platform to enter the first floor of the building.
  4. Get ready for combat as there's a Burer here that you'll need to eliminate.
  5. Once the Burer is down, look beside the window you entered through to find the key for the skybridge doors.
  6. Exit the room and go through the skybridge to unlock the double doors at the end of it to enter the next section.

Finding the Key to the Agricultural Workshop's Roof

Here, you'll need to find the keys to the Agricultural Workshop's roof , which are located behind the locked door in this section.

  1. After entering the next section, make a left turn and go through the hallway until you spot an open door blocked by debris.
  2. Equip your weapon and aim at the lock on the door across the room to open it.
  3. Now go around the corridor and enter through the (now unlocked) door to encounter an Electrical Poltergeist.
  4. After taking care of the mutant, grab the keys to the Old Padlock next to the entrance near the body.
  5. Now head upstairs using the stairwell and unlock the roof.

Acquiring the PSZ-9D Duty Armor on the Skybridge

Once you're on the roof, simply go towards the right until you spot a medkit and a limited edition energy drink sitting on the edge. Grab these items and vault off the roof onto the skybridge below. Run to the end of the skybridge to get the PSZ-9D Duty Armor and a stash full of valuable loot items like medkits and food.

This is how you'll access the Agricultural Workshop and get the great PSZ-9D Duty Armor equipment in Stalker 2 .

item.title: Marvel Rivals Leak Claims a New Vanguard Is on the Way
item.description:
Summary

  • The Hood is rumored to join Marvel Rivals as a Vanguard, surprising fans expecting him as a Duelist.
  • Vanguards like Doctor Strange use shields, bonus health, and regeneration to protect allies.
  • Speculation suggests Blade and Cyclops may also join the game, with potential team-up abilities.

A prominent Marvel Rivals leaker has claimed that The Hood will be coming to the popular hero shooter as a Vanguard. Marvel Rivals is currently in the opening weeks of Season 1: Eternal Night Falls, which features Dracula as the title's main antagonist. While Season 0 took place over the course of several weeks, the developers have stated that a typical full-length season will last for three months.

Marvel Rivals ' Vanguards act as tanks, utilizing large health pools and damage mitigating abilities to protect themselves and allies. These heroes can often be found leading the charge when capturing a point or guiding a convoy. While some Vanguards, like Doctor Strange, put up a shield to block incoming attacks, others use bonus health and regeneration to soak up damage as they dive on enemies. These characters typically rely on healing from Strategists in order to play their role effectively and benefit from the synergy that comes with a good team composition. It is expected that The Thing will be Marvel Rivals ' next Vanguard when he is added in a mid-season update alongside Human Torch.

In a recent post on Twitter, Rivals_Leaks claimed that The Hood will be coming to the hero shooter as a Vanguard. Many fans seemed surprised by the news, as they expected the pistol-wielding villain to be another Duelist in the game's roster. While the character began as a petty criminal, he gained superpowers after defeating a demon and stealing its cloak and boots. With abilities that include levitation and invisibility, he quickly rose to prominence in the underworld of New York City. There's no telling when The Hood may come to the title, but NetEase Games has stated that players can expect to see a new Marvel Rivals hero added every six weeks.

The Hood May Be an Upcoming Vanguard in Marvel Rivals

Some fans have speculated that The Hood could come to the game in the near future, as the current season has a strong focus on New York City. It's also theorized that Blade may come to Marvel Rivals very soon, as NetEase Games revealed official artwork of the vampire hunter as a Gallery Card within Season 1. As of writing, the members of The Fantastic Four are the only characters confirmed to be coming to the title.

Dataminers have been busy digging through the game's files, looking for any clues that may point toward upcoming heroes or villains. In addition to The Hood, Rivals_Leaks claimed players may soon see Cyclops come to Marvel Rivals , though they didn't specify what role the X-Men leader might fill. Many fans are hoping to see the hero come to the game as a Duelist with team-up abilities that highlight his mutant allies. With so much content on the way, many fans are looking forward to seeing what NetEase Games does next.

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail - How To Activate The Floating Platform In Abyss Of Fate Janusopolis (In the Balance Achievement)
item.description:
Arriving at the "Abyss of Fate" Janusopolis during the Heroic Saga of Flame-Chase chapter in Honkai: Star Rail presents Trailblazers with a trial, requiring them to balance the two sides of a scale with the help of the Hand of Zagreus. Once the challenge is complete, players can proceed normally to the next location in Amphoreus.

However, players who wish to revisit the area for exploration, need to activate the Floating Platform . This will allow them to access "Abyss of Fate" Janusopolis's three floors and help them locate every Spiritheif, Nymph, and Treasure chest in Honkai: Star Rail .

How To Activate "Abyss Of Fate" Janusopolis Floating Platform In Honkai: Star Rail

To activate Abyss of Fate Janusopolis Floating Platform In Honkai: Star Rail , Trailblazers must solve the third floor's Ebb and Flow Prophecy Tablet . But to do the latter, players need to reach "Abyss of Fate" Janusopolis's third floor by doing the following:

  • Teleport to the Everdream Gate Space Anchor.
  • Move north behind the moon-marked doors to enter the 3D area.
  • Interact with the Oronyx’s Miracle: Tome of Miracles book on the northern platform to perform a “miracle” and traverse from Evernight to Dawn .
  • Move west, then north.
  • Fix the Unstable Bridge with the Oronyx’s Prayer skill in Honkai: Star Rail .
  • Go toward the Hand of Zagerus mechanic and interact with it.
  • Use the Hand’s flying ability to go to the northeastern corner of the room’s upper floor.
  • Pick up the sphere shape.
  • Fly toward the scale’s eastern platform and place the sphere on it.
  • Exit the Hand of Zagerus mechanic.
  • Move northeast toward the Scale empty platform.
  • Stand on it and wait for it to reach the third floor.

Once players arrive at the upper floor, they will get the In the Balance achievement in Honkai: Star Rail . Trailblazers are blocked from using the northern passage due to the Blacktide Corrosion, but they can still reach the Floating Platform location by undertaking these steps:

  • Go north, then turn east.
  • Enter Janus’ Hidden Passage to reach the eastern platform on the third floor.
  • Move to the room’s southwestern corner.

Next, Trailblazers must solve the Prophecy Tablet that locks the Floating Platform mechanic. To solve the Ebb and Flow Prophecy Tablet in Honkai: Star Rail , follow these steps:

  • Grab the southwestern shape and place it over the eastern yellow-hued triangle.
  • Drag the southeastern fragment to the western yellow-hued triangle.
  • Get the northwestern triangle and put it on the top right part of the triangle to overlap the shapes.
  • Grab the northeastern small triangle and place it on the opposite side of the previous fragment.

Upon solving the Prophecy Tablet puzzle in Honkai: Star Rail , the Floating Platform in "Abyss of Fate" Janusopolis will unlock automatically and players will be able to use it.

item.title: New Co-Op Roguelike Hitting Steam on February 6
item.description:
Summary

  • SWORN, a co-op roguelike, will enter Steam Early Access on February 6, 2025, joining a demo available for players now.
  • Newcomers can explore a fallen Camelot and overthrow Arthur with a vibrant art style, which also features creative gameplay.
  • SWORN joins several upcoming medieval game releases this year and beyond, including Crimson Desert and Blight: Survival.

The co-op action roguelike SWORN is scheduled for a Steam release on February 6, 2025, and it’s a vibrant spectacle from developer Windwalk Games and publisher Team17. The basic premise of the anticipated Steam title highlights that up to four players can take part in the co-op action, exploring a fallen Camelot to reclaim the kingdom from the corruption of Arthur and his Knights of the Round Table.

The final playtest for SWORN went live on January 16, where players could test Ultimate abilities and play through two biomes. It was then announced that SWORN would be open for Early Access at the beginning of February, and for gamers interested in the concept, the live demo offers challenges to complete and several weapons and abilities to master. Despite the wait for SWORN being nearly over, there’s a healthy collection of Arthurian movies and TV shows to bide medieval fanatics’ time in the interim.

Announced on the game’s Steam page and social media, SWORN ’s creative team acknowledged the months of playtests indulged by the community and confirmed SWORN was ready to advance with Early Access. With Camelot’s gates close to opening, players can look forward to fusing their characters' strengths while mastering abilities to overthrow Arthur’s reign, and the game’s marketing touched on the appeal of multiple runs. SWORN will join a host of medieval games due to release in 2025 and beyond, including Crimson Desert and Blight: Survival, and Windwalk Games’ impressive comic world promises to join the best.

Arthurian Co-Op Roguelike SWORN Enters Steam Early Access in February

SWORN also boasts changing battlefields where players’ creativity can peak, with gameplay resembling some of the most complex roguelike games in the ranks. While it’s advertised as a co-op game, solo play is also on offer, where gamers can undertake the role of a Soulforged knight, befriend iconic characters like Merlin and Nimue, and get to the bottom of a darkness spreading over Avalon. Additionally, players can brush up on their Fae lore after swearing loyalty to the Fae Lords, harboring over 200 unique blessings.

Another medieval title releasing in February is Warhorse Studios’ Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 , and it’s an anticipated continuation of Henry’s story. Despite the recent backlash targeting the inclusion of LGBTQ content in the sequel, Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 recently issued an exciting update for fans. Review codes were deployed four weeks ahead of the game’s launch on February 4, 2025, which has also given the developer ample time to iron out any bugs before the game’s full debut.

item.title: 8 Best Transformation Horror Games, Ranked
item.description:
Transformation is a fun concept to play around with. In some media, it’s a bright, hope-inspiring, heroic thing, where the protagonist has become something different and more powerful than their foes can imagine. It’s Goku turning Super Saiyan, Sonic becoming Super Sonic, or a Pokémon evolving into a stronger, more versatile form.

Yet not all transformations are the same. One could become weaker and frailer, or bloodier and more gruesome. Instead of being an exhilarating, liberating process, it can be painful and upsetting, turning the figure into an indescribable abomination. Many games have played around with the horror of transformation, with these games being some of the best examples.

8 Discover My Body

Biological Horror Edutainment

  • Developer: Yames.
  • Platforms: PC, macOS, Linux.
  • Release: March 2020.

There are plenty of big-name games for players to draw on for transformation and body horror. But if they go off the beaten path, they can find some particularly gruesome gems, like the works of Yames. He made his name creating creepy computer games with grisly transformative themes, like Growing My Grandpa and Father Turned Me into Trees and Rivers .

Discover My Body is one of his more straightforward games. It follows a medical student who, in the hopes of uniting humanity via science, infects himself with a strain of fungus. The players have to scan and examine themselves as the fungus spreads and learn how it affects the human body. It produces happiness and a sense of unity, but at a high price.

7 Water Womb World

The Fall of Man Goes Below Sea Level

  • Developer: Yames.
  • Platforms: PC, macOS.
  • Release: June 2020.

Discover My Body has a religious theme, as its medical researcher is seeking a secular alternative to the sense of community religion brought before its people lost faith in it. Water Womb World continues that, as its Catholic researcher looks for proof of the Garden of Eden, believing it to exist on the ocean floor. To do that, players have to catch fish and sift through the seabed to find objects to study.

Though what he finds is anything but divine, as each discovery is more abominable than the last. Yet the researcher finds each one fascinating, growing blind to his own gradual transformation as he becomes as gruesome as his fishy friends. It won't take players long either as, like Discover My Body , it's a fairly short game that doesn't take long to get grisly.

6 Resident Evil 7: Biohazard

The Brain is Just as Vulnerable to Manipulation as the Body

As Yames' games suggest, the brain is just as vulnerable to being distorted in one way or another as the rest of the body. Once it's under control by an otherworldly being or biological horror, the rest of the figure will follow. It turns up in Resident Evil 7: Biohazard too, as lead character Ethan finds his long-lost wife Mia, who can turn from her usual self to being as violent and psychotic as the Baker Family on a dime.

They seemingly can't be killed, as they come back from lethal wounds multiple times. As Ethan presses on, he discovers their inhuman endurance and psychotic fits are the result of a mold infection, where they're being controlled by another figure hiding in the background. If Ethan can't figure out a way to overcome the mold, he could lose Mia for good.

5 Parasite Eve

Squaresoft's Underrated Take on Biological Survival Horror

Aside from being grisly, one of the big fear factors behind body horror is that there’s no escape from it. People can’t run away from their own bodies being distorted one way or the other. Like in Parasite Eve , where the titular Eve can manipulate anyone at the cellular level. She could make whole crowds burst into flames, or melt them into a giant, orange pile of slime.

The result of a genetic experiment gone wrong, Eve aims to wipe out humanity to replace them with her child, the “Ultimate Being”. The only hope of beating her lies in one rookie cop, Aya Brea, who has more in common with Eve than she thinks. Players could find out how they're linked through the game, or by reading the original Parasite Eve novel, which goes further into Eve's creation and mitochondrial manipulations.

4 Resident Evil 2

Umbrella's Chief Scientist Has One of the Series' Sickest Transformations

As grim as RE7 gets, the RE games have offered grimmer transformations. RE4 , though diluted by its action movie yucks, churns the stomach with its eerie credits sequence depicting the Ganados' transformation. The RE1 remake improved the classic game by adding some transformation horror via the Crimson Heads and Lisa Trevor, a young girl turned into a malformed monster by Umbrella. But the first game in the series to really dive into transformation horror was Resident Evil 2 .

One of its main villains, William Birkin, is gradually mutated by the G-Virus until whatever was recognizable about him gets subsumed by the mass of flesh, claws, and eyes. Eventually, he doesn't even look like any natural lifeform on earth. Yet it's suggested he still has some form of his old senses, as he still recognizes his daughter Sherry. Which isn't a good thing, as Claire and Leon have to keep her safe from whatever Birkin's become.

3 Bloodborne

Divine Intervention or an Ungodly Infection

Bloodborne is practically all about the horrors of transformation. The School of Mensis sought to transcend humanity by taking a substance called the Old Blood, and the Healing Church shared it among the citizens of Yharnam to cure all ailments. It kind of worked in that, over time, it cures people and turns them into the monstrous beasts the player’s Hunter has to fight.

The game goes into the lore behind the Old Blood, and the eldritch Great Ones they’re connected to. Though it also goes into the horror of its transformations, showing how the likes of Vicar Amelia are doomed to turn into lethal monstrosities because of the Old Blood and their faith. Depending on what choices the player makes, the Hunter can achieve the School's goal and become something inhuman themselves.

2 Scorn

The Grisly Combination of Iconic Horror Artists with Survival Horror

It’s hard to imagine many works of transformation and body horror being a thing without movies like Alien , nor Alien being a thing without the work of H.R Giger. The late Swiss artist became the go-to figure for body horror and sickly transformations. Developers Ebb Software took note of his work and combined it with the work of another macabre artist to create Scorn , a first-person survival horror game where its leads are trapped in some unearthly realm.

Its techno-organic abominations, flesh-repurposing Assembly, and fates of its silent protagonists are reminiscent of Giger. Though its broken figures, misty monochrome world, and oppressive structures resemble works by Zdzisław Beksiński, who was no stranger to body horror himself. They add an extra layer of unease, sucking out whatever hope players might've found before they discover how grim Scorn gets.

1 Dead Space

If Only They Were Just Zombies

Creepy religious cults aren’t just for gothic horror. EA Redwood Shores managed to find room for one in Dead Space , where adherents of ‘Unitology’ worship artifacts called ‘Markers’, believing they’ll usher in a new world via the “Convergence” (i.e. the end of humanity). Though they’re more than just MacGuffins, as they're also responsible for creating the Necromorphs.

They're undead creatures driven by a hive mind to kill off all forms of life in their vicinity. While formed from dead bodies and disembodied bodyparts, they can mutate in different, horrific ways to attack their prey. Some produce extra limbs to slice people apart, others grab them with stretching tendrils, or chuck their own disembodied heads at them, which will then rip the victim's own head off, and hijack their decapitated bodies.
